title: Electric force - 2Q and 2Q at distance d-over-3

content.question: Two point charges, both with charge <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi></math>, exert an electrostatic force of magnitude <math alttext="F sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> on each other when they are a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> apart. What is the magnitude of the electrostatic force on two other point charges, each with charge <math alttext="2 Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></math>, that are a distance <math alttext="d over 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>d</mi><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math> apart?

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
